title: Command-based DSC Resource Manifest
description: Defines the information DSC and integrating require to process and call a command-based DSC Resource.

manifestVersion.title: Manifest Version
manifestVersion.description: The semver of the DSC Resource manifest schema to validate this manifest with.

version.title: Resource Semantic Version
version.description: The semantic version (semver) of the DSC Resource. This version identifies the DSC Resource, not the version of the application it manages.

description.title: Resource Description
description.description: A short synopsis of the DSC Resource's purpose.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Defines a list of searchable terms for the resource.

exitCodes.title: Exit Codes
exitCodes.description: This property defines a map of valid exit codes for the DSC Resource. DSC always interprets exit code `0` as a successful operation and any other exit code as an error. Use this property to indicate human-readable semantic meanings for the DSC Resource's exit codes.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Semantic Version
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description:
A valid semantic version (semver) string.

For reference, see https://semver.org/
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.$comment:
A valid semantic version ([semver][01]) string.

This value uses the [suggested regular expression][02] to validate whether the string is valid
semver. This is the same pattern, made multi-line for easier readability:

```regex
^(0|[1-9]\d*)\.(0|[1-9]\d*)\.(0|[1-9]\d*)
(?:-(
  (?:0|[1-9]\d*|\d*[a-zA-Z-][0-9a-zA-Z-]*)
  (?:\.(?:0|[1-9]\d*|\d*[a-zA-Z-][0-9a-zA-Z-]*))
*))?
(?:\+([0-9a-zA-Z-]+(?:\.[0-9a-zA-Z-]+)*))?$
```

The first line matches the `major.minor.patch` components of the version. The middle lines match
the pre-release components. The last line matches the build metadata component.

[01]: https://semver.org/
[02]: https://semver.org/#is-there-a-suggested-regular-expression-regex-to-check-a-semver-string

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: DSC Resource fully qualified type name
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description:
The namespaced name of the DSC Resource, using the syntax:

owner[.group][.area]/name

For example:

  - Microsoft.SqlServer/Database
  - Microsoft.SqlServer.Database/User

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Get Method
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Defines how DSC must call the DSC Resource to get the current state of an instance.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Get Method
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Defines how DSC must call the DSC Resource to get the current state of every instance.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Set Method
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Defines how DSC must call the DSC Resource to set the desired state of an instance and how to process the output from the DSC Resource.

implementsPretest.title: Resource Performs Pre-Test
implementsPretest.description: Defines whether the DSC Resource performs its own test to ensure idempotency when calling the `set` command. Set this value to `true` if the DSC Resource tests input before modifying system state.

return.description: Defines whether the command returns a JSON blob of the DSC Resource's state after the set operation or the state and an array of the properties the DSC Resource modified.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Test Method
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Defines how DSC must call the DSC Resource to test if an instance is in the desired state and how to process the output from the DSC Resource.

return.title: Test Command Return Type
return.description: Defines whether the command returns a JSON blob of the DSC Resource's current state or the state and an array of the properties that are out of the desired state.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Validate Method
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Defines how DSC must call the DSC Resource to validate the state of an instance. This method is mandatory for DSC Group Resources. It's ignored for all other DSC Resources.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Provider
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Defines the DSC Resource as a DSC Resource Provider. A DSC Resource Provider enables users to manage resources that don't have their own manifests with DSC.

list.title: List Command
list.description: Defines how DSC must call the DSC Resource Provider to list its supported DSC Resources.

config.title: Expected Configuration
config.description: Defines whether the provider expects to receive a full and unprocessed configuration as a single JSON blob over stdin or a sequence of JSON Lines for each child resource's configurations.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Instance Schema
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Defines how DSC must validate a JSON blob representing an instance of the DSC Resource.

command.title: Instance Schema Command
command.description: Defines how DSC must call the DSC Resource to get the JSON Schema for validating a JSON blob representing an instance of the DSC Resource.

embedded.title: Embedded Instance Schema
embedded.description: Defines the JSON Schema DSC must use to validate a JSON blob representing an instance of the DSC Resource.

type.title: Instance Type
type.description: Defines the JSON type for an instance of the DSC Resource. DSC Resource instances always have the `object` type.

$schema.title: DSC Resource instance schema dialect
$schema.description: Defines which dialect of JSON Schema the DSC Resource is using to validate instances.

$id.title: DSC Resource instance schema ID
$id.description: Defines the unique ID for the DSC Resource's instance schema. If the instance schema is published to its own public URI, set this keyword to that URI.

properties.title: Instance Properties
properties.description: Defines the properties that DSC can retrieve and manage for the resource's instances. This keyword must define at least one property as a key-value pair. The key is the property's name. The value is a subschema that validates the property.

_ensure.title: Standard Property: _ensure
_ensure.description: Indicates that the DSC Resource uses the standard `_ensure` property to specify whether an instance should exist with the `Present` and `Absent` enums.

_inDesiredState.title: Standard Property: _inDesiredState
_inDesiredState.description: Indicates that the DSC Resource returns this value for it's own `test` method. This read-only property is mandatory when the manifest defines the `test` property. It shouldn't be included if the DSC Resource relies on DSC's synthetic testing.

_purge.title: Standard Property: _purge
_purge.description: Indicates that the DSC Resource uses the standard `_purge` property to specify whether the DSC Resource should remove all non-specified members when it manages an array of members or values.

_rebootRequested.title: Standard property: _rebootRequested
_rebootRequested.description: Indicates whether a resource instance requires a reboot after a set operation. To use DSC's built-in reboot notification processing, resources must define this property in their manifest.

url.title: Instance Schema URL
url.description: Defines the URL to the DSC Resource's JSON schema for integrating tools.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Executable Command Name
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: The name of the command to run.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Executable Command Arguments
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: The list of arguments to pass to the command.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Executable Command Input Type
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Defines how DSC should pass input to the command, either as arguments or JSON over stdin.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Return Kind
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.$comment:
While the enumeration for return kind is the same for the `set` and `test`
method, the way it changes the behavior of the command isn't. The description
keyword isn't included here because the respective schemas for those methods
document the behavior themselves.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Ensure Existence
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Indicates whether the DSC Resource instance should exist.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Instance is in the Desired State
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Indicates whether the instance is in the desired state. This property is only returned by the `test` method.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Purge
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Indicates that only the components described in the DSC Resource should exist. If other components exist, the DSC Resource is out of the desired state. When enforcing desired state, the DSC Resource removes unmanaged components.

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.title: Reboot Requested
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerS.description: Indicates that the set operation requires a reboot before it's fully complete.
